result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin L Wynn Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin L Wynn Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Marvin L Wynn Jr.  Attorney Ryan Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29:
Defendant Marvin L Wynn Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Marvin L Wynn Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 21CF5364. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Stewart. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Marvin L Wynn Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Marvin L Wynn Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a State v Lee hearing. Attorney Golden was recently appointed and a hearing is no longer needed. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marvin L Wynn Jr not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Marvin L Wynn not in court, defendant in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin L Wynn not in court, defendant in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with S.F.J.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES:
 Defendant Marvin L Wynn in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Marvin L Wynn in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
Kwarrant
